summary:
Assuming the UNSC presidency, Russia’s ambassador Vitaly Churkin said a compromise on Security Council reform is nowhere in sight, criticizing the “populist” idea of limiting veto powers which provide for minority opinions and guarantee balanced decisions.

title: WHO warns of polio outbreak after 2 cases confirmed in Ukraine
author: RT
summary:
The World Health Organization has confirmed two cases of poliomyelitis in Ukraine, the first in Europe since 2010, warning of a potential outbreak due to low vaccination coverage. However, local authorities claim that the two children could have been paralyzed due to a different disease.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: EU set to extend sanctions on Russian and Ukrainian individuals, firms – reports
author: RT
summary:
The European Union has decided to extend sanctions imposed on a number of individuals and firms in Russia and eastern Ukraine until March 15, 2016, several media outlets reported citing diplomatic sources.
Read Full Article at RT.com

title: The not-so-free encyclopedia: Wikipedia blocks 381 accounts over cash-for-edits scams
author: RT
summary:
Wikipedia has banned 381 editors and removed 210 articles involved in “sock-puppet” scamming, where editors demanded money for posting and promoting certain content on the online encyclopedia.

title: Putin dishes it out against a team of young hockey talents (VIDEO)
author: RT
summary:
Russian President Vladimir Putin teamed up with legendary hockey players for a battle with talented school children. The two goals scored by the president have rocked the Olympic ice stadium in Sochi.

title: Russia celebrates 70th anniversary of Japan’s surrender with military parades (VIDEO)
author: RT
summary:
Cities in Russia's Far East have held military parades honoring the 70th anniversary of Japan’s surrender, which put an end to World War II.
